tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Az-Zumar, Ayah 1?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The instinct for worship and devotion is inherent in human nature, so he must consider a being as great and have feelings of awe for that being. ‘So worship God with your total devotion,’ means to worship only God, praying to Him, revering Him and devoting oneself entirely to Him
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse primarily teach us?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Modern materialism is also a distorted form of this belief, in that it has diverted man’s worshipping instinct from the Creator to the creation. He Who is the Creator and Sustainer of the unfathomably vast universe is far above such ridiculous allegations
distractors: This verse describes the creation of mankind
This verse is about the battles of early Muslims
This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only

tafsirQuiz.question: What deeper meaning is explained in this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In addition, God made extensive provision to fulfil the needs of human beings. As civilization entered the next stage, man harnessed nature’s potential and used it for his progress
distractors: This verse only discusses worldly matters
This verse is primarily about historical events
This verse focuses on scientific facts

tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Az-Zumar, Ayah 7?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Such an acknowledgement amounts to the admission of the Truth, which undoubtedly is the greatest demand of rationality. To accept God and be grateful to Him is sought by the soul of man
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In this way, in times of helplessness, every man comes to know that there is nobody worth worshipping except the one and only God. If a man keeps quiet after making a mistake, it involves the misguidance of only one man
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: A man of knowledge is one whose mind is ignited by the remembrance of God, and that man is devoid of knowledge whose mind is ignited only by material factors
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who are prepared to become believers at the price of patience will be the ones who will be blessed with the superior grace of God. The realisation of the majesty of God makes him humble and he spends his life following the commandments of God
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Not only does he guide his fellow-men but establishes an example by adopting the right path himself. The real call of the prophet yearns to make man discover and worship the one and only God, leaving aside the worship of everything else
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Satan exploits this possibility and misguides people from the right path. Whenever a Truth reveals itself, Satan tries to divert people’s minds from it by misinterpreting it
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Paradise would be the final and perfect manifestation of man’s ambitions, which he wants to fulfill in this world, but cannot. Those who fear God in this world will be made inhabitants of the perfect world of Paradise which would be free of any shortcomings
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Az-Zumar, Ayah 21?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: On the one hand, God has created the external world in a way that everything in it has become a sign of great realities, and, on the other, He has endowed man with the ability to read these signs and understand them
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: It is the nature of man that when he hears some terrible news, or he undergoes some hair-raising experience, his inner being is humbled and his heart is softened by the news
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Man always tries to save his face from injuries, but the punishment of Doomsday will so encompass man that it will not be possible for him to save any part of his body
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Az-Zumar, Ayah 27?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: It is entirely against man’s nature to subscribe to different kinds of loyalties, as a result of which he is unable to do justice to any of them. All arguments and possibilities indicate that there is only one God, who is the Creator of man and who is worthy of being worshipped by him

This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: It is they who will be cast into the fire of Hell, whereas those who mend themselves, become supporters of the Truth and prove themselves to be God-fearing, will have the appreciation of Almighty God, who will overlook their failings and value them for their good deeds

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The greatness of these beings had captured people’s minds to such an extent that when the Prophet Muhammad contradicted the idea of their holiness, they could not understand how they could be other than holy

This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Az-Zumar, Ayah 38?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In every age, man has worshipped beings other than God, but nobody has had the courage to say that their deities created the heavens and the earth, or that the real causes of comfort or distress were in their power

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the central theme of this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Through this system of nature, a man is shown today itself in an elementary manner how he will die and how he will rise up again. If he gives serious consideration to this matter, he will find in this very mundane event a great lesson of the Hereafter

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the main message of Surah Az-Zumar, Ayah 43?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: They are pleased to hear the praises of these beings; the proclamation of the Majesty of the One and only God does not nourish their souls. Their eyes will open only when, on the Day of Judgement, the Majesty of God reveals itself

tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The fact is that the things of the world are meant as a trial for him and not as a reward for his talents. It is decided on some other basis, and that basis is that this world is a testing ground and not a place for the handing out of rewards

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: If one gives serious consideration to these things, one will find in the universe the sign of its Creator and also the sign of its Organizer and Designer

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The world of the Hereafter will be directly illuminated by God’s light (nur). Just as a bell rings as soon as an examination is over, similarly as soon as the time of the world is over, a trumpet will be blown

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: There are varying degrees in rejecting and ignoring the Truth. In the Hereafter, people will be divided into different groups according to their degree and then every group will be put in that part of hell which it deserves

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Az-Zumar, Ayah 73?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The people of Paradise will be given the same treatment in the Hereafter as royal guests receive in this world. At this time the praises of God will be upon every tongue and the atmosphere will resound with hymns praising the Creator
